name: Sally Webster Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from spending 3 nights over the Fourth of July Holiday in Rockport, MA. After some serious disappointments with other B&Bs based on their embellished websites, the Sally Webster Inn is a treasure. We were given 'Sally's Room'. A lovely, spacious room - the size of a larger bedroom, as this B&B is the former home of Ms. Webster. A magnificent mantle over the large decorative fireplace and period furnishings creates a charming room to come back to after a day at the beach or strolling the lovely town of Rockport. The king size bed was quite comfortable, a bonus for someone who suffers from chronic lower back pain. The immaculate room (clean is big with me) has a private bath but please note that the stall shower is on the smaller size. We are taller than some and average in size, and found it to be more than adequate. The window airconditioner worked well and provided the extra bonus of drowning out the traffic noise. Sally's Room is located on the street in the front of the house - right off the front door. And yet it felt very private. The owners are gracious and friendly yet leave you to enjoy the homemade breakfast each morning. We have stayed in many Inns and hotels over the years, and the Sally Webster Inn is a lovely little B&B. It's within walking distance to town and Front Beach - but plan to take your time on the return trip as it is all uphill. Good exercise! We plan to return!
reviews.title: A Gem in the Sally Webster Inn

likes.disliked: — Tiny bath but it is a B&B afterall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in Rockport for the first time and stayed at the Sally Webster Inn for four nights during the last week of June. We felt comfortalbe and at home almost immediately. John and Kathy are open, friendly and focused on our comfort. The breakfast menus are varied and delicious. The cozy dining room encourages lively banter among the guests and John is always available for any special requests. Each room is unique and comfortable. The location is perfert. Just a five minute walk down the hill to picturesque Rockport. Kathy and John are available for recommendations for places to eat, shop and sidetrips. Our pleasant retreat came to an end too soon, but we hope to return again soon, especially to the Sally Webster Inn.
reviews.title: Easy comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night in June whilst doing a tour of new england. Wish I had booked longer. B&B was beautiful, relaxing and welcoming. Felt at home. Inn keepers helpful, warm and homely. Rockport is just lovely. Lots of things to do in local area. Wish we had longer to explore. Lovely eats at the Greenery Cafe. Would recommend B&B without hesitation.
reviews.title: Great B&B

reviews.text: I recently (okay, three months ago) spent two nights at the Sally Webster Inn in Rockport, Mass. It was my first stay at a Bed and Breakfast, and it was a great experience.
reviews.title: A Great First Stay at a Bed and Breakfast!

likes.liked: — The hosts were accommodating and helpful without being intrusive
likes.disliked: — I really can't think of a single thing.

reviews.text: Since I arrived by train, Kathy picked me up at the station, and John drove me back when I left a few days later. I was afraid that staying at a B&B would feel like I was imposing on a stranger's home, but it didn't feel like that at all. My room, William's Room, was located on the top floor (attic) and, while more rustic in feeling than the other rooms, it was perfect for me. Basic amenities included a shower with great pressure, a very comfortable bed, TV, and a nice supply of Hershey's miniatures. John and Kathy also provided a binder full of information on the area, including several great walks. One morning, I woke up and took one of the walks they suggested, and it was fabulous. . . And when I came back, my pot of tea was waiting for me, along with a fresh fruit cup and, a few minutes later, a made-to-order Belgian waffle. Leisurely enjoying my breakfast while reading the Boston Globe provided for me, I felt that I could definitely get used to this kind of service :) (I also enjoyed my breakfast the day before--stuffed French toast. Along with the company of a group of ladies traveling together, I shared some great conversation and wonderful eats.)
reviews.title: Feels like coming home

likes.liked: — clean and cozy; the innkeepers are friendly and helpful

reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights at the Sally Webster Inn in Rockport. I was travelling on my own without a car and so arrived by train to Rockport. It was teeming with rain when i arrived and so it was such a relief to be met by Cathy the owner in her car at the train station. She gave me a great little tour of the area which helped me find my bearings the next day much more easily. It was such an important gesture which really helped my stay.
reviews.title: A warm welcome

likes.liked: — the welcome was exceptional and the personal touch which is evident throughout
likes.disliked: — location was a tad awkward - a bit of a climb coming home

reviews.text: Inn keepers, John and Kathy, welcomed us into their historic inn. They were very helpful, made a delicious breakfast and offered restaurant suggestions. The inn is immaculate and is only a short walk to Bearskin Neck, restaurants and shops. We highly recommend this inn if you are planning a stay in Rockport.
reviews.title: Absolutely charming!!!

likes.liked: — The comfort, warmth, innkeepers and the food.

reviews.title: THE BEST!!!
reviews.text: This is the third time in 6 years that I have stayed at The Sally Webster Inn and it is like going home!! The innkeepers, John ('Fitzy') and Kathy make me feel like I'm family and I enjoy visiting with them. The rooms are extremely clean, comfortable and the attention to details keeps me coming back. The full breakfast, included in the price, is prepared with fresh ingredients and imagination: home-made Belgian waffles with fresh cut-up fruit, cheese, yogurt, coffee, juice, quickbreads, bagels, and that was only our first morning there! The second morning included the Inn's famous baked french toast-yummy! If you are not happy and content and comfortable at the Sally Webster Inn, you should stay home-you probably can't be pleased anywhere!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very charming B&B. Great location to town. The hosts are very helpful. Our bed was large and comfortable. Very clean/spotless. Everything was wonderful. We loved the breakfast. Lost of choices and serve yourself. Everything was homemade and delicious. Early morning coffee available to early risers. Lots of healthy choices along with delicious yummy choices too. I do best with a high protein breakfast without lots of carbs. They had plenty of choices for me so I felt great all day. Also, cold water available througout the day. I would stay her over and over.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: My wife and I have visited Rockport several times in the past on day trips. We had not previously had the opportunity to stay overnight and so finding the Sally Webster Inn which is within easy walking distance of the center of Rockport was terrific. The property is beauitfully maintained with all the charm of old New England. John and Kathy are wonderful hosts and our room (Williams room), was perfectly clean neat and well apointed. Although it is the smallest of the rooms offered, my wife has already decided that that is the room she would ask for again and again, (and I agree).
